results.headline: Review: Hearts of Darkness and Light in ‘The Lost City of Z’
results.summary_short: Charlie Hunnam stars in this period adventure story about love, loss and mystery in the Amazon from the director James Gray.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Lost City of Z

results.headline: Review: ‘A Quiet Passion’ Poetically Captures Emily Dickinson
results.summary_short: Cynthia Nixon brings a great 19th-century American poet to vivid life in Terence Davies’s new film.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Quiet Passion

results.headline: Review: Richard Gere as ‘Norman,’ an Aspirational Fixer
results.summary_short: ‘Norman: The Moderate Rise and Tragic Fall of a New York Fixer,’ Joseph Cedar’s latest film, pits Jew against Jew on the fringes of power and influence.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Norman

results.headline: Review: In ‘Tommy’s Honour,’ a Family Feud on and Off the Green
results.summary_short: The director Jason Connery’s staid biopic is about the 19th-century golf pioneer Tom Morris and his son, with class conflict as a backdrop.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tommy's Honour

results.display_title: My Entire High School Sinking Into the Sea
results.headline: Review: Angst, Jealousy and ‘My Entire High School Sinking Into the Sea’
results.summary_short: Teenage anxiety (voiced by Dash Shaw, Lena Dunham and others) takes a back seat to survival after an earthquake hits a cliffside high school.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of My Entire High School Sinking Into the Sea

results.headline: Review: In ‘Mimosas,’ a Cryptic Mountain Trek
results.summary_short: In following nomads on a mission in Morocco, this tale considers the fortifying power of faith, while scrambling the viewer’s sense of time.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mimosas

results.headline: Review: ‘Maurizio Cattelan: Be Right Back’ Relishes a Mischievous Artist
results.summary_short: The documentary explores the artworks and pranks of an Italian trickster.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Maurizio Cattelan: Be Right Back

results.headline: Review: In ‘Little Boxes,’ a Biracial Family Meets a White Town
results.summary_short: A family ventures beyond the bubble of gentrified Brooklyn to a small town and is thrown out of its comfort zone.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Little Boxes

results.headline: Review: ‘Finding Oscar,’ and Hope, in Massacre’s Aftermath
results.summary_short: This documentary looks at a Guatemalan village that was wiped out during a civil war, and searches for one of the few survivors.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Finding Oscar

results.display_title: Chasing Trane: The John Coltrane Documentary
results.headline: Review: In ‘Chasing Trane,’ Where’s the Joy of Sax?
results.summary_short: John Scheinfeld’s documentary about John Coltrane draws on interviews, including those with Bill Clinton, Carlos Santana and Cornel West.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Chasing Trane: The John Coltrane Documentary

results.display_title: By the Time It Gets Dark
results.headline: Review: A Fragmented Past in ‘By the Time It Gets Dark’
results.summary_short: In examining a violent suppression of university protesters in Bangkok, this film uses a mutating narrative to reflect the impossibility of revisiting history.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of By the Time It Gets Dark

results.headline: Review: ‘All These Sleepless Nights’ Roams the Streets of Warsaw
results.summary_short: A Polish film follows its young protagonist as he flirts, attends parties until dawn and gyrates to a perpetual backbeat.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of All These Sleepless Nights

results.headline: Review: ‘Heal the Living,’ a Sentimental Sales Pitch for Organ Donation
results.summary_short: Life, death and a heart transplant are at the center of this French film that moves among three distinct groups.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Heal the Living

results.headline: Review: Family Values and Hot Rides in ‘Fate of the Furious’
results.summary_short: Each installment of “Fast and Furious” is more enjoyably ludicrous than the last, even as the death of the star Paul Walker continues to hang over the franchise.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Fate of the Furious

results.headline: Review: The ‘Glory’ of a Good Deed (and Its Fallout)
results.summary_short: A railroad worker dutifully turns in the cash he finds strewn across on the tracks but soon comes to regret it in this incisive, funny Bulgarian film.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Glory

results.headline: Review: ‘Your Name’ Takes Adolescent Identity Crises to Extremes
results.summary_short: Manohla Dargis reviews Makoto Shinkai’s latest film, a lovely and touching Japanese animation in which teenagers find themselves trading bodies and lives.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Your Name

results.headline: Review: ‘Graduation’ and the Anguish of Living Vicariously
results.summary_short: An excruciating ethical problem arises for a man whose dream for his daughter — to win a scholarship to study in England — is threatened.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Graduation

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Transfiguration,’ Coping With Bullies and Craving Blood
results.summary_short: A New York teenager in low-income housing tries to establish a relationship with a young woman as he wrestles with his sanguinary pursuits.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Transfiguration

results.headline: Review: 3 Teenagers Seek a Voice in ‘Speech & Debate’
results.summary_short: Stephen Karam’s film adaptation of his own play is a comedy about students who don’t quite fit in but insist, in their clumsy way, on being heard.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Speech & Debate

results.headline: Review: ‘Going in Style’ Proves Crime Has No Age Limit
results.summary_short: Michael Caine, Alan Arkin and Morgan Freeman star in a comedy about old dudes who rob a bank, a remake of a 1979 movie.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Going in Style
